title: Why do rivers curve?

options.text: The mountain streams are corralled by steep-walled valleys.

options.label: C
options.text: The mountain streams have softer soil.

options.text: The mountain streams are more prone to erosion.

options.label: B
options.text: A decrease in the river's width.

options.label: C
options.text: A little disturbance and a lot of time.

options.label: B
options.text: The bank becomes weaker and starts to crumble.

options.label: A
options.text: It speeds up and carries more sediment.

options.label: B
options.text: It slows down and drops sediment to the bottom.

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of the fast-moving water near the outside bank of a meandering stream?

options.label: A
options.text: It slows down and drops sediment.

options.label: B
options.text: It speeds up and carries more sediment.

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between the width of a meandering stream and the length of one S-shaped meander?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The length of one S-shaped meander is about equal to the width of the channel.

options.label: C
options.text: The length of one S-shaped meander is about six times the width of the channel.

options.label: D
options.text: The length of one S-shaped meander is about ten times the width of the channel.

multiple-choice.question: What happens when a meandering stream's curves grow curvier and eventually loop around themselves?

options.label: C
options.text: The stream follows the straighter path downhill, leaving behind an oxbow lake.

multiple-choice.question: What is another name for an oxbow lake?
Where can oxbow lakes occur?

options.label: D
options.text: Only in areas with high water flow.

What is the result of defects in DNA repair?

options.label: A
options.text: Premature aging and many kinds of cancer

options.label: B
options.text: Increased lifespan and resistance to disease

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the process that removes a long strand of nucleotides and replaces them with fresh ones to repair damage caused by UV light?
What is the benefit of beneficial mutations in DNA?

options.label: A
options.text: They can cause cancer and premature aging

options.label: B
options.text: They can allow a species to evolve

options.label: C
options.text: They can lead to genetic disorders

options.label: D
options.text: They can result in cell death

options.label: B
options.text: Start with one and add invisible zeros on either side, then add them together in pairs

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: How misused modifiers can hurt your writing

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary issue with the sentence "Thief robs town with world's largest chocolate bunny"?
What is the function of modifiers in a sentence?

options.label: B
options.text: To add information about other parts of a sentence

options.label: D
options.text: To alter the tone of the sentence

multiple-choice.question: What happens when modifiers are not linked clearly enough to the words they refer to?
How can the sentence "Thief robs town with world's largest chocolate bunny" be corrected?

options.label: B
options.text: By rephrasing the sentence to make it clearer what the modifying phrase is talking about

multiple-choice.question: What is a dangling modifier?

options.label: A
options.text: A modifier that is clearly linked to the word it refers to

options.label: B
options.text: A modifier that appears to be modifying nothing at all

options.label: C
options.text: A modifier that is placed at the end of a sentence

options.label: D
options.text: A modifier that is used to create ambiguity

multiple-choice.question: How can the problem of a dangling modifier be solved?

options.label: B
options.text: By giving the modifier something to modify

multiple-choice.question: What is a squinting modifier?

options.label: A
options.text: A modifier that is clearly linked to the word it refers to

options.label: B
options.text: A modifier that appears to be modifying nothing at all

options.label: C
options.text: A modifier that is stuck between two things and could feasibly refer to either

options.label: D
options.text: A modifier that is used to create ambiguity

multiple-choice.question: How can the ambiguity caused by a squinting modifier be clarified?

options.label: B
options.text: By putting the modifier closer to its intended phrase

multiple-choice.question: Why is it important to avoid verbal ambiguity in sentences?

options.label: B
options.text: To add complexity to the sentence

options.label: C
options.text: To maintain grammatical law and order

options.label: D
options.text: To change the tone of the sentence

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary goal of using modifiers effectively in sentences?

options.label: B
options.text: To add complexity to the sentence

options.label: C
options.text: To make it clear which parts of the sentence modifiers belong to

options.label: D
options.text: To change the tone of the sentence
